Class MyList

java.lang.Object
MyList
public class MyList extends Object
The MyList class implements a growable array of integers. Like an array, it contains elements that can be accessed using an integer index. However, the size of a MyList can grow or shrink as needed to accommodate adding items after the MyList has been created.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    MyList()
    Constructs an empty list so that its internal data array has size 10.
    MyList(int initialCapacity)
    Constructs and empty list with the specified initial capacity.

    • MyList

      Constructs and empty list with the specified initial capacity.
      Parameters:
      initialCapacity - the initial capacity of the list

  • Method Details

    • get

      public int get(int index)
      Access an element from the list given an index.
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the element in the list to be accessed
      Returns:
      the element at that index

    • set

      public void set(int index, int newValue)
      Replaces the element at the specified position in this list with the specified element.
      Parameters:
      index - the specified index
      newValue - what the element is to be set to

    • add

      public void add(int newValue)
      Adds the specified element to the end of this list, increasing its size by one.
      Parameters:
      newValue - the element to be added

    • findNumber

      public int findNumber(int value)
      Returns the index of the first occurrence of the specified element in this list, or -1 if this list does not contain the element.
      Parameters:
      value - element to search for
      Returns:
      the index of the first occurrence of the specified element in this list, or -1 if this list does not contain the element

    • getAverage

      public double getAverage()
      Returns the average of the numbers stored in the list. It is assumed that the list has at least one number when this method is called.
      Returns:
      average of the numbers in the list

    • display

      public void display()
      Prints the values of the list on a single line. The values will be separated by a single space. It also adds a newline at the end of the last number.

    • deepCopy

      public MyList deepCopy()
      Returns a clone of this list. The copy will contain a reference to a clone of the internal data array, not a reference to the original internal data array of this MyList object.
      Returns:
      a clone of this list

    • isMatch

      public boolean isMatch(MyList otherList)
      Compares the otherList list with the current list for equality. Returns true if and only if the other list is also a List, both Lists have the same size, and all corresponding pairs of elements in the two Lists are equal. (Two elements e1 and e2 are equal if (e1==null ? e2==null : e1.equals(e2)).) In other words, two Lists are defined to be equal if they contain the same elements in the same order.
      Parameters:
      otherList - the other list to be compared for equality with the current list
      Returns:
      true if the specified other list is equal to the current list

    • reverse

      public void reverse()
      Reverses the order of elements in this list in place. After calling this method, the element at index i will be moved to index n-1-i, where n is the size of the list.
